flashcards.title: DMV California Practice Flashcards - Set 4
flashcards.description: 12 essential DMV questions covering peace officers, medications, crossing guards, and parking rules for California driving test

cards.question: A peace officer is signaling you to drive to the edge of the roadway. You decide to ignore the officer's warning and flee the scene. You are guilty of a misdemeanor and can be punished by being:
cards.answer: jailed in the county jail for not more than one year

cards.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?
cards.answer: most cold medications can make a person drowsy

cards.question: Instructions from school crossing guard must be obeyed:
Which of the following is true about large trucks?
cards.answer: trucks often appear to travel slower because of their large size

cards.question: If there is a deep puddle in the road ahead, you should:
The speed limit in any alley is:
This yellow sign means:
cards.answer: vehicles on this road travel in two directions

cards.question: You are approaching a sharp curve in the road. You should:
cards.answer: start braking before you enter the curve

cards.question: When parking on any hill, always set your parking brake and:
cards.answer: leave your vehicle in gear or the "park" position

cards.question: All children under age six riding in your vehicle must use a child passenger restraint system unless:
cards.answer: they weigh 60 pounds or more and wear a safety belt

cards.question: This yellow sign means:
cards.answer: there is a pedestrian crossing ahead

cards.question: This lane in the middle of a two-way street is used to:
cards.answer: begin or end left turns, or start a permitted U-turn
